remarks: If the topology of ` R ` is Hausdorff, and ` R ` is a complete uniform space, then the canonical homomorphism from the real numbers to ` R ` is continuous.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 17-Jan-2018.)
statement:

rrhf.z $e |- Z = ( ZMod ` R ) $.

rrhf.2 $e |- ( ph -> R e. NrmRing ) $.
rrhf.3 $e |- ( ph -> Z e. NrmMod ) $.
rrhf.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( chr ` R ) = 0 ) $.
rrhf.5 $e |- ( ph -> R e. CUnifSp ) $.
rrhf.6 $e |- ( ph -> ( UnifSt ` R ) = ( metUnif ` D ) ) $.
rrhcn $p |- ( ph -> ( RRHom ` R ) e. ( J Cn K ) ) $.
